alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 7:49AM MDT until April 13 at 7:05AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Forecast flooding increased in duration for the following rivers in Montana... Beaver Creek near Hinsdale affecting Valley County. For the Beaver Creek...including Hinsdale...Major flooding is occuring. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Beaver Creek near Hinsdale. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM MDT Tuesday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 12.8 feet Thursday morning. It will then rise to 13.0 feet Friday morning. It will fall to 12.1 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then rise to 12.2 feet early Tuesday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 04/18/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM MDT.
